#pragma config(Motor,  port7,           leftMotor,    tmotorNormal, openLoop, reversed)
#pragma config(Motor,  port1,           rightMotor,     tmotorNormal, openLoop, reversed)
//*!!Code automatically generated by 'ROBOTC' configuration wizard               !!*//

task main()	//Where the code runs
{
	wait1Msec(2000);			// Robot waits for 2000 milliseconds before executing program

	// Move forward at full power for 3 seconds
	motor[rightMotor] = 60;		  // Motor on port2 is run at half max (60/127) power forward
	motor[leftMotor]  = 60;		  // Motor on port3 is run at half max (60/127) power forward
	wait1Msec(2000);		  // Robot runs previous code for 2000 milliseconds (2s) before moving on
	
	// waits for 1 second
	motor[rightMotor] = 0;		  // Motor on port2 halts
	motor[leftMotor]  = 0;		  // Motor on port3 halts
	wait1Msec(1000);		  // Robot runs previous code for 1000 milliseconds before moving on
	
	//When I first tested the turning the code below I had it runnning for 2 seconds
	//that made the robot turn 270 degrees
	//so in order to make it turn 90 degrees(270/3), I divided the time by 3. 2000/3 =~ 666

	// Make a 90 degree turn right 
	motor[rightMotor] = 60;		  // Motor on port2 is run at half max (60/127) power forward
	motor[leftMotor]  = -60;	  // Motor on port3 is run at half max (60/127) power forward
	wait1Msec(666);			  // Robot runs previous code for 666 milliseconds before moving on
	
	// waits for 1 second
	motor[rightMotor] = 0;		  // Motor on port2 halts
	motor[leftMotor]  = 0;		  // Motor on port3 halts
	wait1Msec(1000);		  // Robot runs previous code for 1000 milliseconds before moving on
	
	motor[rightMotor] = 60;		  // Motor on port2 is run at half max (60/127) power forward
	motor[leftMotor]  = 60;		  // Motor on port3 is run at half max (60/127) power forward
	wait1Msec(2000);		  // Robot runs previous code for 2000 milliseconds (2s) before moving on

}
